com.camerontec.catalys.server.sessionmanager

Interface IClientConnectionManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultClientConnectionManager, EMXConnectionManager, SgxClientConnectionManager, UserPassClientConnectionManager, UserPassFromPasswordStoreClientConnectionManager

    public interface IClientConnectionManager
extends IComponent
    Interface for objects which establish a party connection and log on to a session.

    The inherited setActive method provided by IComponent can be used to start and stop connection manager. The inherited open method is the best place to perform any configuration.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.IComponent

        ACTIVE_KEY, NAME_KEY, NOT_EFFECTED_BY_HIGH_AVAILABILITY, SERVICE_ALWAYS_ACTIVE

    • Method Detail

      • isConnectionScheduled

        boolean isConnectionScheduled()
        Determines whether we think we should be connected at this time.
        Returns:
        True if should be connected.

      • getCheckInterval

        long getCheckInterval()
        Attribute which determines how frequently we check the status of active connections.
        Returns:
        Number of millseconds between attempts.

      • setCheckInterval

        void setCheckInterval(long checkInterval)
        Attribute which determines how frequently we check the status of active connections.
        Parameters:
        checkInterval - Number of millseconds between attempts.

      • isLogAllConnectionAttempts

        boolean isLogAllConnectionAttempts()
        Attribute which determines whether every failed connection attempt should be logged.

        If false (the default), only the first failed attempt is logged.

        Returns:
        True if all attempts should be logged.

      • setLogAllConnectionAttempts

        void setLogAllConnectionAttempts(boolean logAllConnectionAttempts)
        Attribute which determines whether every failed connection attempt should be logged.

        If false (the default), only the first failed attempt is logged.

        Parameters:
        logAllConnectionAttempts - True if all attempts should be logged.

      • getReconnectDelay

        long getReconnectDelay()
        Attribute which determines how long we should wait between reconnect attempts.
        Returns:
        Number of millseconds between attempts.

      • setReconnectDelay

        void setReconnectDelay(long reconnectDelay)
        Attribute which determines how long we should wait between reconnect attempts.
        Parameters:
        reconnectDelay - Number of millseconds between attempts.

      • isResetOnLogon

        boolean isResetOnLogon()
        Reset on logon attribute determines if an automatic sequence number reset should occur with each logon.
        Returns:
        Reset on logon attribute

      • onSessionManagerExit

        void onSessionManagerExit(Object cause)
        Called by associated SessionManager just prior to exiting. Parameter indicates the reason it exited.
        Parameters:
        cause - Object indicating the cause for the exit. This should be either a LogoutMessage or an Exception. May also be null.

      • setMaxLogonAttempts

        void setMaxLogonAttempts(int maxLogonAttempts)
        Set the maximum number of logon attempts allowed.
        Parameters:
        maxLogonAttempts - The maximum number of logon attempts allowed. A negative value or 0 implies no limit.

      • setStopReconnectOnSeqNumTooLow

        void setStopReconnectOnSeqNumTooLow(boolean stopReconnectOnSeqNumTooLow)
        Set the attribute whether to continue logon attempts if sequence number is too low.
        Parameters:
        stopReconnectOnSeqNumTooLow - whether to continue logon attempts if sequence number is too low.
